sentences.english: Many monks ran away, climbing into the trees nearby and escaping by hiding in the houses of the neighborhood.
sentences.chinese: 很多僧人跑開，爬上附近的樹，藏在社區的房子裏。

sentences.english: The story was of the Buddhist monk and the goblet.
sentences.chinese: 這則故事是關於一個佛教僧人和一個酒杯的故事。

sentences.english: Jian Ming Yuan was compiled by Yuan Nian who was Buddhist monk in Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 《兼名苑》是唐代僧人釋遠年編纂的類書。

sentences.english: In this manner, Sangha can free their mind and concentrate on their practices to achieve the Holy Path.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，僧人才能全心全力的專注在聖道的修行。

sentences.english: The dervish es whirl around and around without getting dizzy.
sentences.chinese: 苦修僧人反覆旋轉而不感到頭暈。

sentences.english: Why do Monastics Prefer Skateboards to Bicycles?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼僧人比自行車喜歡滑板？

sentences.english: Behind the hall is the residence of the abbot and monks.
sentences.chinese: 正殿後面是方丈和僧人的住處。

sentences.english: Monks must abstain from killing living things. Therefore, monks are vegan.
sentences.chinese: 僧侶戒殺生，所以僧人是素食主義者。

sentences.english: Afterwards, one of the monks gave us some gum.
sentences.chinese: 後來，其中一個僧人給了我們一些口香糖。

sentences.english: The work, which has great value in Buddhism history, is important linguistic corpora.
sentences.chinese: 它包舉了二百五十七個僧人，是佛教史上的重要著作。

sentences.english: He disguised himself as a monk.
Two monks are on a day-long walk to a temple.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，兩個僧人長途跋涉要到一個寺院去。

sentences.english: The sannyasi had listened to all this with quiet attention.
sentences.chinese: 那位僧人安靜而關注地聽了這番對話。

sentences.english: A vagrant monk was using the pavilion as his abode. I am sure the city lights at night must look wonderful from there.
sentences.chinese: 停中有流浪僧人獨宿，夜間看市內燈火一定很美。

sentences.english: It is important to be respectful of the monks that are praying and working in the temple.
sentences.chinese: 尊重寺裏祈禱並工作的僧人很重要。

definition: lama, spiritual teacher in Tibetan Buddhism
one of three fabled islands in Eastern sea, abode of immortals
square zhang (i.e. unit of area 10 feet square)/monastic room 10 feet square/Buddhist or Daoist abbot/abbot's chamber
Xuanzang (602-664), Tang dynasty Buddhist monk and translator who traveled to India 629-645
